text: GitHub - gabotechs/dep-tree: allows visualising a "code base entropy" using a 3d force-directed graph of files and the dependencies between them.

Brief overview:The dep-tree tool is designed to assist developers in maintaining clean and decoupled code bases. It features the capability to visualize code base entropy through a 3D force-directed graph, which illustrates the files in a project and the dependencies among them. This innovative approach helps in identifying and managing complex dependencies within software projects, promoting better software architecture and easier maintenance.If you don't like the summary, just downvote and I'll try to delete the comment eventually üëç

Bouncy Ball - Compare Web Animation Techniques

Main Points:The link compares different web animation techniques using a bouncy ball animation as an example. It highlights various methods including Vanilla JS, CSS, Canvas, jQuery, GreenSock, and several others, illustrating how each can be used to animate a bouncing ball. The project serves as an educational tool for developers to learn about the strengths and weaknesses of each animation technique, offering a hands-on comparison to help choose the best approach for specific scenarios.If you don't like the summary, just downvote and I'll try to delete the comment eventually üëç
